lead_paragraph: The Bears signed the first-round draft pick Greg Olsen to a five-year contract, making Olsen, the tight end from Miami, the first player taken in the first two rounds to agree on a deal. The 31st overall pick, Olsen was the first tight end taken in the opening round by the Bears since they chose Mike Ditka from Pittsburgh in 1961. The contract has a maximum value of $10.696 million.
